column4: If I have an Intel Core 2 Duo on my laptop. Should I use the 64-bit version of ubuntu?
but it wont be much difference i think
is the 64:bit more "buggy" or is it just like the 32bit but i could  get a little extra from it?
i'm using 64 bit right now, bought a new computer amd64
but it could also be fast in 32bit mode
however i have 4 gig of ram now, which is fully used, i could expand it more and 64 bit supports that, 32 bit not
nice. :) ill try that live-cd then. another question. can u install directly from the livecd?
anything i shoudl do in Vista before I try this if I want to dual-boot?

I am using Windows Vista on the laptop right now. but I want to have both vista and ubuntu. so I want to have dualboot on it. and anything I need to do in vista to get this to work before I install ubuntu on it?
it might not work because vista uses nfts and ubuntu cant resize it, but give it a try
but I have 2 disks on this one, so if i just format it in ubuntu it shouldnt be a problem?
yes the first one for vista and the second for ubuntu is good, it will format the second one
